summary: Typography flow must not block writing; use progressive reveal
problem_statement: Typography or formatting flows that block the editor—waiting for confirmation, showing blocking dialogs, or requiring explicit user action before continuing—interrupt the writer's flow. Attention is fragile; any pause to 'deal with' the UI breaks the thinking state. Writers need typography and formatting to feel invisible: changes apply progressively, reveal on demand, or happen in the background. Blocking typography flows violate the epic's core promise.
in_scope: Audit existing typography/formatting flows for blocking behavior
Refactor blocking flows to non-blocking (progressive reveal, inline, or deferred)
Ensure no modal or confirm required for typography changes during writing
out_of_scope: Visual styling changes (P2 accent, breathing space)
Rich text editor (stay with textarea + Markdown)
requirements: Typography flow does not block writing or require modal/confirm
Formatting changes apply progressively or inline
No regression in time to first keystroke or input latency
Epic DoD: typography flow is non-blocking
acceptance_criteria: No blocking modals or dialogs for typography/formatting during Write
Formatting changes are progressive or inline
Writer can continue typing without interruption from typography UI
Accessibility of formatting controls is preserved
dependencies: P1-uix-02 (Slide-out metadata panel) — typography controls may live in or near metadata
risks: Progressive reveal may feel 'magical' or confusing if not discoverable
Deferred application could create expectation mismatch
implementation_notes: P1-uix-03 completes Phase 1 structural changes. Typography here means font, size, spacing, or any formatting that affects the writing surface. Progressive reveal: show options on hover, apply on blur, or reveal in a non-blocking overlay. Reference epic DoD: typography flow non-blocking.
